alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster County through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Olivebridge, or 9 miles west of Kingston, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Hurley, Woodstock, West Hurley, Lake Katrine, Olivebridge, Port Ewen, Veteran, Centerville, Mount Marion, Ashokan, Rolling Meadows, Glenford, Atwood, Shultis Corners, Sweet Meadows, Pacama, Sawkill, Hillside and Zena. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
